results.title: It's a business doing pleasure
results.creator_credit: Sharon Connolly, John Moore and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: An intelligent look at prostitution, focusing on sex workers, Vicky and Gillian, two of the thousands of women working in the sex industry in Victoria. They work in one of Melbourne’s legal brothels and give a detailed explanation of the practicality of their work, of which sex is only one component. Vicky and Gillian earn more than women in low skill jobs, but experience none of the benefits of other wage earners. Also covers the work of the Prostitutes’ Collective of Victoria.

results.title: Palm Beach
results.creator_credit: Albie Thoms and Albie Thoms Productions
results.brief_description: A quasi-documentary fiction film about the suburban sub-culture of of Sydney’s northern beach areas. It is, simultaneously, a fast-paced thriller involving surf, drugs and rock n roll. Forty eight hours in the lives of a handful of young Australians. Paul was looking for work … Joe was looking on. Stars Nat Young and Bryan Brown. Rated: M

results.title: Bingo, bridesmaids and braces
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Tristram Miall and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In this documentary the lives of three working class women are examined as they grow up from the “not so innocent” age of fourteen, to “it’s happening too fast” at eighteen, through to “well we survived”, at the ripe young age of 26. During these years we witness the women confronting the very real issues of teenage pregnancy, love versus sex, and career choices.

results.title: Rocking the foundations
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, Australian Film Commission. Creative Development Branch and Bower Bird Films
results.brief_description: A film that goes behind the headlines to look at the extraordinary chain of events that has made the New South Wales Builders’ Labourers’ Federation the controversial part of Australian history that it is today. It is a story about workers who began to act for themselves and make decisions about issues that affected ordinary people. Also looks at the new policies that saw women introduced into the building industry, limited tenure of office and the use of union power to assist resident action and environmental groups. Narrated by Pat Fiske. (NOTE: 16mm print is black and white.)

results.title: Eora corroboree
results.creator_credit: Barbara A. Chobocky, Michael Le Moignan, Yuri Sokol and Corroboree Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Black futures (A)”.
For 40,000 years, the Aboriginal people of Australia had a rich and diverse culture, which sprang from and reflected their way of life and beliefs. Their culture was not written, but spoken, sung and performed. Since the coming of white man their culture has very nearly been destroyed. Aboriginal playwright, screenwriter and director Bob Merritt believes that a resurgence of Aboriginal culture is possible and in 1984 set up the Eora Centre for the Visual and Performing Arts in Redfern to offer young Aboriginals a comprehensive education in their traditional arts. Looks at the role of the Eora Centre and interviews some of its teachers and students.

results.title: William Dobell
results.creator_credit: Dahl Collings, Geoffrey Collings and Collings Productions
results.brief_description: William Dobell has been acclaimed the greatest portrait and character painter of the twentieth century. The film with some 85 examples, reviews and interprets the artist’s work and development from his early days of struggle in London to his success in later times. This review of the work of Dobell includes not only some of his great portraits but also some examples of his early paintings. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Whole man
results.creator_credit: John Gray, Dahl Collings, Geoffrey Collings and Collings Productions
results.brief_description: Training at the Royal South Sydney Hospital Rehabilitation Centre: tells the story of a coal miner, Vic McGee, who loses both feet in an accident. He and others are taught special exercises not only to maintain physical fitness, but also to build morale.

results.title: Russell Drysdale
results.creator_credit: Dahl Collings, Collings Productions and Qantas Airways
results.brief_description: Shows the development of Australian artist, Russell Drysdale, over a period of 25 years and interprets his vision and concept. The film is based on over eighty paintings assembled from private and public collections. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: A Man and his dog
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Supreme Sound Studios
results.brief_description: An account of the training of Kelpie dogs in the handling of sheep on an Australian sheep station. Explains the possible origin of the breed; shows the special training a dog receives from the time he is a small pup until he can muster and control a mob of a thousand or more sheep; shows the confidence of the dog and the bond of friendship which springs up between the animals and their masters.

results.title: Jump the fence
results.creator_credit: Natalie Green, Lucy MacLaren and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Two young girls who feel restricted at home decide to escape in a gelati van. After a short burst of freedom they end up in Winlaton, a girls’ training centre.
